com.bluecubs.xinco.core.server.vaadin.wizard

Class XincoWizard

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponent
      • com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponentContainer
        • com.vaadin.ui.CustomComponent
          • com.bluecubs.xinco.core.server.vaadin.wizard.XincoWizard
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.vaadin.event.MethodEventSource, com.vaadin.terminal.Paintable, com.vaadin.terminal.Sizeable, com.vaadin.terminal.VariableOwner, com.vaadin.ui.Component, com.vaadin.ui.ComponentContainer, Serializable, EventListener

    public final class XincoWizard
extends com.vaadin.ui.CustomComponent
    Component for displaying multi-step wizard style user interface.

    The steps of the wizard must be implementations of the WizardStep interface. Use the addStep(WizardStep) method to add these steps in the same order they are supposed to be displayed.

    The wizard also supports navigation through URI fragments. This feature is disabled by default, but you can enable it using #setUriFragmentEnabled(boolean) method. Each step will get a generated identifier that is used as the URI fragment. If you wish to override these with your own identifiers, you can add the steps using the overloaded addStep(WizardStep, String) method.

    To react on the progress, cancellation or completion of this XincoWizard you should add one or more listeners that implement the WizardProgressListener interface. These listeners are added using the addListener(WizardProgressListener) method and removed with the removeListener(WizardProgressListener).

    Based on code from Teemu PÃ¶ntelin / Vaadin Ltd
    Author:
    Javier A. Ortiz Bultron
    See Also:

    • Method Detail

      • setLocale

        public void setLocale(Locale locale)
        Overrides:
        setLocale in class com.vaadin.ui.AbstractComponent

      • cancel

        public void cancel()
        Cancels this XincoWizard triggering a WizardCancelledEvent. This method is called when user clicks the cancel button.

      • finish

        public void finish()
        Triggers a WizardCompletedEvent if the current step is the last step and it allows advancing (see WizardStep.onAdvance()). This method is called when user clicks the finish button.

      • next

        public void next()
        Activates the next WizardStep if the current step allows advancing (see WizardStep.onAdvance()) or calls the finish() method the current step is the last step. This method is called when user clicks the next button.

      • back

        public void back()
        Activates the previous WizardStep if the current step allows going back (see WizardStep.onBack()) and the current step is not the first step. This method is called when user clicks the back button.

      • setHeader

        public void setHeader(com.vaadin.ui.Component newHeader)
        Sets a Component that is displayed on top of the actual content. Set to null to remove the header altogether.
        Parameters:
        newHeader - Component to be displayed on top of the actual content or null to remove the header.

      • getHeader

        public com.vaadin.ui.Component getHeader()
        Returns a Component that is displayed on top of the actual content or null if no header is specified.

        By default the header is a WizardProgressBar component that is also registered as a WizardProgressListener to this XincoWizard.

        Returns:
        Component that is displayed on top of the actual content or null.

      • addStep

        public void addStep(WizardStep step,
                    int pos)
        Method for adding steps not at the end of the wizard steps. If you are trying to add one at the end use use addStep(WizardStep step) instead.
        Parameters:
        step - Step to add
        pos - Position to add the step
